<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/g7-ministers-agree-corporate-minimum-tax?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Teamwork Makes the Corporate Tax Dream Work
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Former Fed Chair Janet Yellen" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzY2L2Zvcm1lcl9mZWRfY2hhaXJfamFuZXRfeWVsbGVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, the finance ministers from G7 nations <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/05/us/politics/g7-global-minimum-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced their support</a> for a global corporate minimum tax of 15%, which would require companies to pay at least a 15% rate in each country they operate in. It represents one of the biggest attempts to bring an outdated global tax system from black-and-white into Technicolor.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Multinational companies have been taking advantage of existing tax rules by shuffling money between jurisdictions with super-low rates. The IMF estimates that 40% of all foreign direct investment is “<a href="https://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/fandd/2019/09/the-rise-of-phantom-FDI-in-tax-havens-damgaard.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phantom</a>” in nature, meaning it’s money that passes through empty corporate shells, often for the purposes of lowering a company’s tax bill. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This scheming is not in the best interests of countries that want to collect more taxes from large corporations. The Biden administration estimates a global minimum tax system would lead to $500 billion in additional tax revenue for the US over the next decade. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But wait, there’s more</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In addition to the 15% minimum tax, the agreement by the G7 (which, by the way, is composed of Canada, France, Germany, the US, Italy, Japan, and the UK) calls for an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/g-7-nations-agree-on-new-rules-for-taxing-global-companies-11622893415?mod=hp_lead_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extra tax on profits</a> from the “largest and most profitable multinational enterprises.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The provision is meant to address European leaders’ concerns that they can’t sufficiently tax tech giants like Facebook and Google, because while those companies make tons of money in Europe, they are based in the US and pay taxes there.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now comes the hard part</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The G7 ministers will have to sell their plan to other countries, such as Ireland, that oppose the 15% minimum tax. Ireland has managed to attract lots of tech jobs due to its low corporate tax rate of 12.5%, and it won’t want to give up that competitive advantage.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The teamwork shows that the US and its European allies are putting some of the bad blood of the Trump years behind them. But any new tax system will take years to implement and will surely <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-05-21/the-push-to-lift-corporate-taxes-will-end-up-cutting-them?utm_content=view&utm_medium=social&cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-view&utm_source=twitter&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&sref=htOHjx5Y" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">create headaches</a> of its own.    </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/el-salvador-move-adopt-bitcoin-legal-tender?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
An Important Person Tweeted About Adopting Bitcoin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/el-salvador-move-adopt-bitcoin-legal-tender" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bitcoin as dollars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDcyL2JpdGNvaW5fYXNfZG9sbGFycy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...and guess what, it wasn’t Elon Musk.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, El Salvador’s president, Nayib Bukele, said he’s going to send a bill to the legislature to make <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/05/el-salvador-becomes-the-first-country-to-adopt-bitcoin-as-legal-tender-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bitcoin a legal tender</a> in the country. It’d be the first country to formally adopt the cryptocurrency as part of its economy.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why El Salvador? </strong>Much of the Central American country already operates <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-57373058?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outside the bounds</a> of formal finance:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>70% of the population does not have a bank account.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>20% of the country’s GDP comes from remittances, which are payments sent by Salvadorans living abroad back to the country.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bukele said that bitcoin could help streamline those cumbersome cross-border payments, while promoting “financial inclusion” for those left out of the system. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>There aren’t many details yet, and Bukele’s not sweating them. At 39 years old, he’s savvy with social media and extremely popular with his constituents—his approval rating is more than 85%. This bitcoin bill should easily pass. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here:</strong> Bukele’s announcement came in a taped message delivered to the Bitcoin 2021 conference in Miami.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Here’s a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/05/technology/miami-worship-bitcoin.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fun read</a> describing the ridiculousness of the event. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/booster-shot-faq?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Booster Shot FAQ
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/booster-shot-faq" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="vaccine clock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU5L3ZhY2NpbmVfY2xvY2suanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So you’ve got your vaccination card nicely laminated and hanging on your office wall. Should you make room for another one? Here are some answers to your booster shot questions...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Will I need to get a booster shot for Covid? </strong>Probably, but scientists aren’t sure when because we don’t know enough yet about the length of immunity conferred by vaccines. However, Dr. Peter Marks of the FDA told CNN that vaccinated people likely won’t need a booster shot <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/28/health/covid-19-immunity-booster-shots-wellness/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">within a year</a> of receiving their initial doses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If I got the Moderna vaccine, do I need to get a Moderna booster shot? </strong>Likely not, though studies are progressing to make sure vaccine mashups are safe. Experts <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/06/science/covid-vaccine-boosters.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tell the NYT</a> mix-and-matching vaccines is a “tried and true concept from before Covid.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Are any countries giving booster shots right now? </strong>Yes, the Mideast nation of Bahrain is <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/bahrain-offers-pfizer-booster-got-120029424.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">administering shots</a> of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine to some people who received China’s Sinopharm vaccine. Bahrain is confronting a surge in infections despite having a top-tier immunization rate (important note: The government said 90% of new infections were from people who haven’t been vaccinated at all).</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/key-performance-indicators-june-7?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Sometimes it takes the weekend to find the juiciest numbers from the jobs report released the Friday before. Here’s one: Average hourly earnings for workers in leisure and hospitality <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/us-leisure-hospitality-pay-surges-record-now-will-workers-come-2021-06-04/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose to $18.09 in May</a>, their highest level ever. But is that enough to attract more employees and alleviate the worker shortage? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“It doesn't matter who you are, you can be the pope, the queen of England, the president of the United States, you cannot use our services—and I hope most people would think this is reasonable—to aid, abet, foment, or praise acts of violence.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On ABC yesterday, Facebook executive Nick Clegg <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/06/06/facebook-vp-trump-suspension-492008?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defended</a> the company’s decision to ban former President Trump’s account for at least two years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Profiles of NBA stars <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/01/magazine/the-misunderstood-genius-of-russell-westbrook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Russell Westbrook</a> and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/02/magazine/kevin-durant-brooklyn-nets.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kevin Durant</a> from the NYT Magazine.</p>

CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/week-ahead-june-7?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Apple WWDC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzU0L2FwcGxlX3d3ZGMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re in what CNBC calls the “void between earnings season and the next Fed meeting.” So if you want to bounce for a vacation and not miss much, now’s a good time...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">WWDC:</strong> Apple’s big developer conference kicks off today with the keynote address at 1pm ET (<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0TD96VTf0Xs" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">you can watch here</a>). Despite being virtual for the second straight year, expect announcements with <a href="https://www.theverge.com/22457534/apple-wwdc-2021-rumors-ios-15-new-macbook-pro-what-to-expect?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">updates</a> to its operating systems, a hardware drop here and there, and of course some epic hype videos. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data:</strong> Hope you’re not sick of talking about inflation, because the big economic data point of the week will be the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/04/amc-meme-stocks-could-spark-more-heat-in-the-week-ahead-as-investors-await-inflation-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">consumer price index</a> Thursday. Prices in May are expected to have increased even more than they did in April.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong>Going to genuinely write “Happy Friday” in every correspondence on Friday, because on that day…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Soccer’s European Championship starts</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Pulitzer Prize winners are announced</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>In the Heights</em></span><span> comes to theaters</span>
</li>
</ul>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTAXES \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/06/g7-ministers-agree-corporate-minimum-tax?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTeamwork Makes the Corporate Tax Dream Work\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Former Fed Chair Janet Yellen\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNzY2L2Zvcm1lcl9mZWRfY2hhaXJfamFuZXRfeWVsbGVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlex Wong/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday, the finance ministers from G7 nations \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/05/us/politics/g7-global-minimum-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced their support\u003c/a\u003e for a global corporate minimum tax of 15%, which would require companies to pay at least a 15% rate in each country they operate in. It represents one of the biggest attempts to bring an outdated global tax system from black-and-white into Technicolor.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eMultinational companies have been taking advantage of existing tax rules by shuffling money between jurisdictions with super-low rates. The IMF estimates that 40% of all foreign direct investment is “\u003ca href=\"https://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/fandd/2019/09/the-rise-of-phantom-FDI-in-tax-havens-damgaard.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephantom\u003c/a\u003e” in nature, meaning it’s money that passes through empty corporate shells, often for the purposes of lowering a company’s tax bill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis scheming is not in the best interests of countries that want to collect more taxes from large corporations. The Biden administration estimates a global minimum tax system would lead to $500 billion in additional tax revenue for the US over the next decade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut wait, there’s more\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn addition to the 15% minimum tax, the agreement by the G7 (which, by the way, is composed of Canada, France, Germany, the US, Italy, Japan, and the UK) calls for an \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/g-7-nations-agree-on-new-rules-for-taxing-global-companies-11622893415?mod=hp_lead_pos5\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextra tax on profits\u003c/a\u003e from the “largest and most profitable multinational enterprises.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe provision is meant to address European leaders’ concerns that they can’t sufficiently tax tech giants like Facebook and Google, because while those companies make tons of money in Europe, they are based in the US and pay taxes there.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow comes the hard part\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe G7 ministers will have to sell their plan to other countries, such as Ireland, that oppose the 15% minimum tax. Ireland has managed to attract lots of tech jobs due to its low corporate tax rate of 12.5%, and it won’t want to give up that competitive advantage.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe teamwork shows that the US and its European allies are putting some of the bad blood of the Trump years behind them. But any new tax system will take years to implement and will surely \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-05-21/the-push-to-lift-corporate-taxes-will-end-up-cutting-them?utm_content=view\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-view\u0026utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_campaign=socialflow-organic\u0026sref=htOHjx5Y\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreate headaches\u003c/a\u003e of its own.    \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...and guess what, it wasn’t Elon Musk.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday, El Salvador’s president, Nayib Bukele, said he’s going to send a bill to the legislature to make \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/05/el-salvador-becomes-the-first-country-to-adopt-bitcoin-as-legal-tender-.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebitcoin a legal tender\u003c/a\u003e in the country. It’d be the first country to formally adopt the cryptocurrency as part of its economy.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy El Salvador? \u003c/strong\u003eMuch of the Central American country already operates \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-57373058?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutside the bounds\u003c/a\u003e of formal finance:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e70% of the population does not have a bank account.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e20% of the country’s GDP comes from remittances, which are payments sent by Salvadorans living abroad back to the country.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBukele said that bitcoin could help streamline those cumbersome cross-border payments, while promoting “financial inclusion” for those left out of the system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThere aren’t many details yet, and Bukele’s not sweating them. At 39 years old, he’s savvy with social media and extremely popular with his constituents—his approval rating is more than 85%. This bitcoin bill should easily pass. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here:\u003c/strong\u003e Bukele’s announcement came in a taped message delivered to the Bitcoin 2021 conference in Miami.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eHere’s a \u003ca width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo you’ve got your vaccination card nicely laminated and hanging on your office wall. Should you make room for another one? Here are some answers to your booster shot questions...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWill I need to get a booster shot for Covid? \u003c/strong\u003eProbably, but scientists aren’t sure when because we don’t know enough yet about the length of immunity conferred by vaccines. However, Dr. Peter Marks of the FDA told CNN that vaccinated people likely won’t need a booster shot \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/28/health/covid-19-immunity-booster-shots-wellness/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewithin a year\u003c/a\u003e of receiving their initial doses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf I got the Moderna vaccine, do I need to get a Moderna booster shot? \u003c/strong\u003eLikely not, though studies are progressing to make sure vaccine mashups are safe. Experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/06/science/covid-vaccine-boosters.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etell the NYT\u003c/a\u003e mix-and-matching vaccines is a “tried and true concept from before Covid.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAre any countries giving booster shots right now? \u003c/strong\u003eYes, the Mideast nation of Bahrain is \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/bahrain-offers-pfizer-booster-got-120029424.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadministering shots\u003c/a\u003e of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine to some people who received China’s Sinopharm vaccine. Bahrain is confronting a surge in infections despite having a top-tier immunization rate (important note: The government said 90% of new infections were from people who haven’t been vaccinated at
